title: Live news: The week ahead
FirstFT: Russia exploits a billion-dollar shipping loophole
description: Also in today’s newsletter, Pakistan appoints a caretaker prime minister and Deloitte resigns as auditor of Adani Ports

title: Russia exploits billion-dollar oil cap loophole
description: Inflated shipping costs offer opportunity to bring in more cash

title: UK universities and unions urged to negotiate as strikes hit students
description: Minister calls for talks as ‘damaging’ marking boycott leaves undergraduates without degree results

title: Inflation in focus as UK and China data lands
description: Plus Spain’s parliament returns and Ecuador goes to the polls

title: No, there isn’t a ‘democratic deficit’ in the EU
description: A busy timetable of polls at national and European level will show that voters’ choices matter

title: Saudi Arabia appoints first envoy to Palestinians
description: Move comes as US attempts to broker deal to normalise relations between Riyadh and Israel

title: Ukraine’s civilian death toll mounts as Russia strikes Kherson
description: Shelling of villages comes as Russian warship fires warning shots on commercial vessel heading to Black Sea port

title: What India needs is more cricket and less Bollywood
description: As the Indian Premier League adapts to the digital age, Hindi films lose fans thanks to stale scripts and ageing stars

title: How far will UK inflation fall?
description: Market Questions is the FT’s guide to the week ahead

title: The impoverished choice of mayor facing Londoners
description: The Uxbridge by-election result has led to debate on policy but a new voting system will squeeze out fresh candidates

title: Republican districts dominate US clean tech boom
description: A year after passage of IRA and Chips Act, vast majority of investment is going to red states

title: Unite delays account filings for 2 years as financial probe continues
description: Head of UK’s second-largest trade union has been investigating possible irregularities under previous leadership

title: Deadliest US wildfires in a century claim 93 lives in Hawaii
description: Toll expected to continue rising after blazes sweep through tropical island of Maui

title: Britain’s corporation tax system needs a long-term fix
description: The levy hinders business investment and stifles productivity growth

title: Deloitte resigns from Adani Ports as auditor
description: Indian conglomerate says company’s grounds for resignation are ‘not convincing’

title: Korea battery materials maker onshores China supply chain to win US subsidies
description: Posco’s battery materials chief says company is targeting the growing EV market

title: Multinationals turn to generative AI to manage supply chains
description: Geopolitical tensions and new laws requiring companies to monitor environmental and human rights abuses in their supply networks drive interest

title: The perils of impenetrable gibberish
description: A Hungarian doctor and Donald Trump show why it’s important to get your message across clearly at work

title: Victorian sewers not to blame for England’s pollution, research shows
description: Water company excuses for spills debunked by findings that most infrastructure was built in 20th century

title: Demand for pawnbroking hits ‘record levels’ in UK
description: High inflation and shortage of alternatives are a boon, says chief of Britain’s biggest operator

title: Europe’s thriving businesses face mounting windfall tax hit
description: Levies which initially focused on banks and energy are now spreading into other sectors

title: Private equity groups bet on UK healthcare as NHS waiting lists grow
description: Number of deals in sector hits highest level in a decade despite wider M&A slowdown

title: Zambia’s plan to dig its way out of debt with a copper revival
description: With its former mining capital in disrepair, the central African nation is seeking new investment to help reverse its past mistakes

title: Hong Kong’s corporate lawyers test boundaries as Beijing’s influence grows
description: Chinese territory’s long-cherished reputation as global legal hub is now in question

title: China and Japan pass by on the stairs of inflation
description: Parallels between Beijing’s economic challenges and those of Tokyo’s lost decades don’t tell the whole story
